title: Margot Robbie stuns in a lively yellow suit as she steps out of her Manhattan hotel
text:
She'll be reprising her role as Harley Quinn for the upcoming Suicide Squad spin-off Birds Of Prey.

But Margot Robbie skipped her character's candy-colored locks in favor of a stunningly elegant yellow suit on Sunday.

The 29–year–old Oscar-nominee looked effortlessly stylish as she stepped out of her hotel in Manhattan's Tribeca neighborhood.

Style queen: Margot Robbie, 29, stunned in a pastel yellow suit Sunday as she left her hotel in Manhattan's Tribeca neighborhood

Margot channeled 1980s style with the her suit from The Attico.

She wore the pastel yellow jacket draped over her shoulders as she exited the hotel, and she had on a plain white blouse underneath.

Later, she put her arms back in the jacket, revealing its oversize fit.

The 5ft6in beauty was matched a pair of pointy yellow heels in the same shade as her suit.

Casual elegance: She channeled 1980s style with the suit from The Attico, which she wore draped over her shoulders

On theme: The 5ft6in beauty was matched a pair of pointy yellow heels in the same shade as her suit

Margot's voluminous dirty blonde tresses were swept to the side and rested gently over her shoulders.

The Wolf Of Wall Street star stuck with minimal accessories, only carrying along a golden metallic clutch.

Her tastefully made-up face matched the elegant suit, and she added a splash of crimson to her lips.

Blonde beauty: Margot's voluminous dirty blonde tresses were swept to the side and rested gently over her shoulders

Earlier this month, Margot appeared in the new trailer for Birds Of Prey (And The Fantabulous Emancipation Of One Harley Quinn), a new comic book action film that picks up after her character Harley has split up from the Joker (played in Suicide Squad by Jared Leto).

The new film will find the actress transitioning into the role of vigilante hero after Harley rounds up a group of female anti-heroes to protect a young girl who steals a diamond from the crime lord Black Mask, played by Ewan McGregor.

Margot is producing the upcoming superhero flick, and its director Cathy Yan will become the first Asian woman to direct a superhero film.

Coming soon: Earlier this month, Margot appeared in the trail for her upcoming Suicide Squad spin-off Birds Of Prey

New gig: The storyline focuses on Harley's attempts to protect a young girl from a vicious crime lord while also coming to grips with her breakup from the Joker

The movie will follow a banner year for the actress, who starred in the high-profile historical film Mary Queen Of Scots.

She played another real-life figure, Sharon Tate, in Quentin Tarantino's rapturously received film Once Upon A Time In Hollywood, a fictional version of the events leading up to murders committed by followers of Charles Manson.

Margot was also featured in the thriller Dreamland, which premiered at the Tribeca Film Festival in April, though it has yet to receive an official release.

Her next project will be Bombshell, an exploration of Fox News CEO Roger Ailes' harassment and abuse of multiple female employees, which will be released on December 20.
description: Once Upon A Time In Hollywood star Margot Robbie gave passerby a glimpse of her glamorous style Sunday when she emerged from her hotel in a vibrant yellow suit.
